title: Add ability to pass CFLAGS and LIBS into bootstrap toml

labels.name: T-bootstrap
labels.description: Relevant to the bootstrap subteam: Rust's build system (x.py and src/bootstrap)

labels.name: C-feature-request
labels.description: Category: A feature request, i.e: not implemented / a PR.

body:
https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/src/bootstrap/config.toml.example

The Haiku cross compiler needs CFLAGS (include directories) and LIBS (-lroot and friends) added to the bootstrap.

I don't see an option in the config.toml.example to define these.
(under the # Options for specific targets)

Here is my usage:
```
[host.x86_64-unknown-haiku]
cc = "x86_64-unknown-haiku-gcc"
cxx = "x86_64-unknown-haiku-g++"
[target.x86_64-unknown-haiku]
cc = "x86_64-unknown-haiku-gcc"
cxx = "x86_64-unknown-haiku-g++"
```
Being able to pass "include paths" and lib search paths here would be helpful. (cflags would help cover this)

Here would be my ideal usage:
```
[host.x86_64-unknown-haiku]
cc = "x86_64-unknown-haiku-gcc"
cxx = "x86_64-unknown-haiku-g++"
cflags="-I/home/kallisti5/Code/haiku/headers/posix -I/home/kallisti5/Code/haiku/headers -L/home/kallisti5/Code/haiku/generated.x86_64/objects/haiku/x86_64/release/system/libroot/"
[target.x86_64-unknown-haiku]
cc = "x86_64-unknown-haiku-gcc"
cxx = "x86_64-unknown-haiku-g++"
cflags="-I/home/kallisti5/Code/haiku/headers/posix -I/home/kallisti5/Code/haiku/headers -L/home/kallisti5/Code/haiku/generated.x86_64/objects/haiku/x86_64/release/system/libroot/"
```
